intro: Pilosella leptoclados, commonly known as the slenderleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Pilosella leptoclados is often found in moist to dry soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
